title: Who is considered a German hero? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would say that Konrad Adenauer, nicknamed “Der Alte,” who at age 73 became Chancellor of the new Federal Republic of Germany, and for 14 years led Germany from the ashes of the genocidal National Socialist, war-loving tyranny of Adolf Hitler into the bright sunshine of political freedom, free market economics, peaceful, pro-western limited democratic government. He was not only a hero for Germany, proving that you need not destroy the world to make Germany great, but to all those who believe in the ideals he espoused.

Mostly, A very high volume of people considered Adolf Hitler, as the Hero of Germany for his many good or bad deeds ( for the world and Germany itself). But there are many other names also, who can come in the list of German Hero: Arminius: Arminius was the Prince and Chieftain of the Cherusci tribe. He was a chieftain of the Germanic Cherusci tribe who is best known for commanding an alliance of Germanic tribes at the Battle of the Teutoburg Forest in AD 9. Modern historians have regarded Arminius victory as Rome’s greatest defeat. Karl Plagge: Plagge had a great contribution to his land. According to historian Kim Priemel, the success of Plagge’s rescue efforts was due to working within the system to save Jews, a position which required him to enter a “grey zone” of moral compromise, and Plagge always insisted “I am not a hero”.
